page.title: 11METHLEIGH FARM
page.content: Methleigh Farm was built before 1066 and was in the original Domesday Book. Before the Norman Conquest it was owned by the Bishop of Exeter. After the conquest it was given to Robert of Normandy. The present tenant is a man called Mr.Dawson from St.Austell. They employ two people, one part time, the other full time. They own about twenty fields which adds up to about eighty acres. The main land use is crops. They use modern methods of farming and have about five tractors. They also have five riding horses plus a family cow and calf.
